ul.li1: 1Come down and sit on the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon!
ul.li2: Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of Chaldea!
ul.li1: For they shall no longer callLiterally “you shall not add they shall call to” you tender and delicate.
ul.li2: 2Take the pair of mill stones and grind flour!
ul.li1: Uncover your veil,
ul.li2: strip off your skirt,
ul.li1: uncover your thigh,
ul.li2: pass through the rivers!
ul.li1: 3Your nakedness shall be exposed;
ul.li2: indeed, your shame shall become visible.
ul.li1: I will take vengeance
ul.li2: and I will not spareLiterally “plead with” a person.

chapter.p: 4Our redeemer, Yahweh of hosts is his name, the holy one of Israel.

ul.li1: 5Sit silently and go into the darkness, daughter of Chaldea,
ul.li2: for they shall no longer callLiterally “you shall not add they shall call to” you mistress of kingdoms.
ul.li1: 6I was angry with my people;
ul.li2: I profaned my inheritance,
ul.li1: and I gave them into your hand.
ul.li2: You did not giveLiterally “set up” them mercy;
ul.li1: on the aged you made your yoke very heavy.
ul.li2: 7And you said, “I shall be an eternal mistress forever!”
ul.li1: You did not set these things upon your heart;
ul.li2: you did not remember its end.
ul.li1: 8Therefore now hear this, luxuriant one who sitsOr “sitting” in security,
ul.li2: who saysOr “saying” in her heart, “I am, and besides me there is no one.
ul.li1: I shall not sit as a widow,
ul.li2: and I shall not know the loss of children.”
ul.li1: 9And these two shall come to you in a moment, in one day:
ul.li2: the loss of children and widowhood shall come on you completely,Literally “as their fullness”
ul.li1: in spite of your many sorceries,
ul.li2: in spite of the power of your great enchantments.
ul.li1: 10And you felt secure in your wickedness;
ul.li2: you said, “No oneLiterally “none” seesOr “is seeing” me.”
ul.li1: Your wisdom and your knowledge led you astray,
ul.li2: and you said in your heart, “I am, and besides me there is no one.”
ul.li1: 11And evil shall come upon you, you will not know;
ul.li2: it will be on the lookout for her.
ul.li1: And disaster shall fall upon you; you will not be able to avertLiterally “make amends” it.
ul.li2: And ruin shall come on you suddenly; you do not know.
ul.li1: 12Stand, now, in your enchantments,
ul.li2: and in your many sorceries with which you have labored from your youth.
ul.li1: Perhaps you may be able to benefit;
ul.li2: perhaps you may scare away.Literally “terrify”
ul.li1: 13You struggle with your many consultations;Or “advice”
ul.li2: let them stand, now, and save you—
ul.li1: those who see the stars, divide the celestial sphere,Literally “heavens,” that is, for astrology
ul.li2: who inform by new moons—
ul.li3: from those things that are coming upon you.
ul.li1: 14Look! They are like stubble;
ul.li2: the fire burns them completely.
ul.li3: They cannot deliver themselvesLiterally “their lives” from the powerLiterally “hand” of the flame;
ul.li1: there is no coal for warming oneself,Literally “to grow warm”
ul.li2: no fire before which to sit.
ul.li1: 15So are to you those with whom you have labored,
ul.li2: your traders from your youth.
ul.li1: They wander, each to his side;
ul.li2: there is no one who can save you.
